data.title: Great Taste...
data.text: The best latin restaurant for me, no doubt. Is the only place where I can have the real latin food taste..

data.title: Good Peruvian Food
data.text: This was off my beaten path and I stopped in to experience something different. It is in an older strip mall and wasn't very inviting from the outside. The inside was colorful and much more appealing than the exterior. There were about 30 diners with me as the only Caucasian which I took to be a good sign. I had their rotisserie chicken with rice and beans that the waitress told me was their most popular dish. It was very good. The chicken was moist and tasty. I finished off with some Peruvian Ice Cream and I was a little disappointed with it. At $6.00 I didn't find it exceptionally good especially not at that price.

data.title: Yum
data.text: I stopped going to El Rocoto a couple of years ago. It seemed to be hit and miss depending on who was cooking. This past weekend I was in the neighborhood and so I was close by and gave it another shot. With two Peruvian toddlers in tow, I ordered the Tallarines verde and the chicken nuggets with fries. You can never go wrong with home made french fries, but I have had some bad Tallerines verde in my life. When made right it is an exquisite dish. It was quite good, the best I've ever had in the USA at least. The service was slow and confusing at times, but that is pretty typical. My friend ordered a half chicken and anticuchos, and her child devoured them. The place was not overly crowded for a Saturday, and I think I will give it another try for consistency soon.

data.title: Good food but prepare for slow service
data.text: Great little restaurant tucked away in the heart of West Valley City.  Great Peruvian food but they are a little short staffed so if you have a large group prepare for a long wait.  Lomo Saltado is great but my favorite is their dessert the Alfajores.  Delicious and delicate cookies similar to Russian Tea Cakes and Mexican Wedding Cookies.  The price is good for the portions but again, if you're looking for some fast service, this is not the place.

data.title: "Found a fly in my food"
data.text: I went a few times to this Peruvian Restaurant. I went with with friends and my friend found an ant in her food. We talk to the owner and she apologize but she charge my friend the plate with the ant . My friend left almost the plate full of food. After 2 months I went my kids for dinner and I found myself a fly and my daughter found a hair on the food. I ask if I can talk to the manager and I show him the fly and the hair, he acts like is not a big deal. And he ask me "are you sure is not your hair?". I was upset and I say "are you going to ask me if the fly was my too?" . And his answer was I just ask you because sometimes people find some excuses. So they don't have to pay. I show him my receipt because I show the fly and the hair after I pay my bill. Bad service, manager should never work there, he's not professional . I like pollo a la brasa  that's why I went there. Wish somebody can have a better Peruvian Restaurant in Utah .

data.title: worth a visit
data.text: This was our first sampling of Peruvian cuisine.  We both agreed the flavors were wonderful.  I had  the appetizer with mixed seafood in lime juice.  Absolutely wonderful combination!  My husband had the rotisserie chicken.  The chicken was moist and yummy and A+ on the fries!  HUGE quantities.  Don't know why all the reviews about skimpy helpings.  We had more than we could eat!  Also loved the sweet onion/cilatro relish.  Warning, the green sauce is HOT!!!  The atmosphere was nonexistent and the place was cold.  I had to keep my coat on.  But if you are looking for something different than Mexican, try El Rocoto.   It's worth a visit.

data.title: Horroble service
data.text: My first time is in this restaurant and my expectations was not I expected. The lady took 10 mns to bring inca colas and crystal. We also ordered chicha and she forgot. We had to constantly remind her for our drinks. (It was completely empty when we arrived to the restaurant). She gave us dirty cups.  Come on, she didn't even wash the cups. Nasty!!! About 25 mns later got packed and we still did not get our food. I got even more upset when the other customers got their food right before us. We were the 2nd table. And to top it off, she ordered the weong food. VERY DISAPPOINTED.My experience in this restaurant for the time HORRIBLE.

data.title: GOOD PERUVIAN FOOD!!!
data.text:
I ordered ceviche and my friends ordered Pollo a la Brasa, it comes with salad and fries,
The waiter was very friendly and the prices were fair, Good Peruvian Food in the Valley.

data.title: Good food, but have drastically cut portions and increased prices.
data.text:
We've been going there once every month or two for about three years in a row. Our favorite dish— Pollo a la Brasa (A style of Peruvian Chicken served with salad and fries) has recently gone up in price. This initially was understandable and wasn't a big deal (with the economy and all more than understandable), because the value initially was so good. The price hike really didn't phase us, it's what happened after that left us feeling bad.

Today we ordered, as take out, Pollo a la Brasa. The man whom is either the owner or a manager was the very one to fill the bag for the take out. I didn't look at each individual container because all of my past experience had been very consistent in terms of the quantity and quality of the food. I took it home (a 50 min ride) and when we served it up (a family of three, with the third being just a toddler) both the visual and physical volume of the french fries was notably less than half what we were accustomed to receiving.

Normally I'd just take an issue like this up directly with the management of an establishment, but when it so clearly was the manager that was the final deliverer of the food I'm hard pressed to believe that a quite petition would help.

The thing that hurt the most was just that we felt like we'd found a reliable restaurant with good food at a great value. I hate the feeling of having to keep tabs on those I patron to feed my family.

Can't say we won't go back. The food's quality and flavor is awesome. But I can't say they will be providing our next Peruvian fix. Nor that they will remain our favorite source in Utah of Peruvian food.

Hemos sido clientes del restaurante cada mes o dos tras las ultimas tres años seguidos. Nuestro plato favorito—Pollo a la Brasa recien se subio el precio. Eso en si mismo no fue una problema (del hecho con la economia como es bien razonable), no nos importo porque el valor dado en la comida fue tan bueno. Asi que no fue el hecho de subir los precios que nos dejo amargos sino lo que paso despues.

Hoy dia pedimos un orden de Pollo a la Brasa para llevar a casa. El hombre que me lo entrego, creo que es duenio o jefe principal, fue el mismo que lleno nuestro bolsa. No revisa las cajas del orden porque nuestro experiencia hasta entonces siempre fue uno constante con respecto a la calidad y cantidad de comida. Lo lleve a mi casa (una viaje de 50 minutos) y encontrabamos que las papas que nos dieron fueron la mitad o menos de lo que nos habian dado antes. Eso fue obvio en la aperencia fisica de las papas y en el hecho que no nos llenaron para nada.

Por lo general, en casos asi, empezaria en forma privada contactar el los que manejan el negocio para avisarles de la situacion, pero cuando el mismo que se junto y me dio el orden es el a quien estaria reportando no veo la utilidad en eso.

Lo peor es que pensemos que habiamos encontrado un establecimiento de calidad y valor. Odio la sensacion de que tengo que siempre estar revisando para evitar que alguien esta provechando de mi confianza o que piensen que solo porque tienen lo mejor en algo que se pueden provechar de los que les apoyan en otras cosas.

No puedo decir que no nos regresamos. Pero tampoco diria que van a ser nuestro primer opcion cuando vamos buscando comida Peruana. Tampoco que quedaran nuestro destino favorito para comida Peruana.

data.title: Not That Good!
data.text: Looks bad on the outside and inside, and taste doesn't make up for that. I ordered ceviche, the fish seemed like it was cooked on a grill first then doused in lemon juice, it shouldn't be grilled! Second, I grew up in South America, so I know my Latin food, but the waiter refused to accept my order unless I pointed at it on the menu, either he didn't know Spanish, or he doesn't know what's on their menu. Third: the waiter took my order, brought my food, and that's it. He didn't refill drink, he didn't bring my bill, and he sat and visited with his buddies. Service sucked, food wasn't that good, and appearance wasn't promising. Save yourself the money and go to a different place.

data.title: Authentic and delicious Peruvian food
data.text:
Despite being hidden away in a strip mall in nowhere West Valley City, El Rocoto serves up muy rico comida! Although the restaurant doesn't look like much on the outside the food inside makes up for that deficiency. 

Last week I took a group here for lunch and as we walked in I could tell they were feeling skeptical. Only one person in the group had tried Peruvian food before and no one knew what to expect. I assured them the food would be delicious and then started hoping it would be... Thankfully the food was great! 

We started off with Papa a la Huancaína, a traditional dish of boiled yellow potatoes in a spicy, creamy sauce called Huancaína sauce. If you're new to Peruvian cuisine, you seriously need to try this dish! Peru is known for their potatoes. In fact, there are about 5,000 potato varieties worldwide and 3,000 of them are found in the Andes alone! Why's that? Well, would it surprise you to know the potato was first domesticated in Peru? 

For the main course I ordered one of my favorites, Lomo Saltado, which is basically a stir fry of thinly slicked beef with red onions and tomatoes served over a bed of fresh, homemade french fries and white rice. The Lomo Saltado had a great flavor and was well prepared. Unfortunately some of the beef was a little tough and fatty, but overall it was a good dish. To drink I had chicha morada, a sweet Peruvian beverage made from purple corn. Chica morada is usually made by boiling corn with pineapple, cinnamon, clove, and sugar. It may sound like an unusual drink but it's really good and worth trying out. Order it by the glass or by the pitcher.

I don't remember what everyone ordered, but I knew two people ordered Tallarin Al Pesto Camarones, which is basically spaghetti with a spinach, pesto sauce. They said it was very good. I think it included a thin cut of beef or chicken. 

Overall I was really happy with El Rocoto. If you want Peruvian food this is a good place to go. The portions were BIG and the prices were fair. Service was great. I would eat here again.

data.title: Good choice for Rotisserie Peruvian Chicken
data.text: We are fans of Peruvian Chicken and had good choices on the east coast, but hadn't found a good one in the Salt Lake area.  Tried El Rocoto yesterday and we were pleasantly surprised.  The chicken was very good and the yucca appetizer was excellent.  It is very evident that the owner and staff take pride in their restaurant, as it was clean, nicely decorated, good flute music and the server was very attentive and helpful.  Recommend if you like Peruvian Chicken, especially if you are in the west side of Salt Lake City.

data.title: Great seafood
data.text:
My friend recommended this restaurant a while ago; I finally took my family for dinner on 1/5/13. We were not disappointed the décor is pleasant; the service was prompt and courteous, my wife order the tiger’s milk, it’s a concoction if lime juice with different kinds of sea food and other juices, it’s like Ceviche but much more delicious, it went well with side of white rice. I shared the fried seafood platter with my 13 yr old daughter and was more than enough food for two people, tender fried pieces of fish clams shrimps accompanied by 3 kinds of dipping sauces two of them were a little too hot (spicy) for my taste. My son (teen age) had the fried chicken with the fried yucca (starchy, tuberous root extensively cultivated in South America), he enjoyed it very much. Next time I definitely have to try the rotisserie chicken that most of the other patrons were ordering. 
For a family of four we spent less than $45 dollars with drinks.

owner_response.author: El Rocoto P, Manager at EL ROCOTO PERUVIAN RESTAURANT, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for your time  ..... thank for you review  we want to see you soon back
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: excellent flavors
data.text: we've been to this restaurant a few times, but today everything was great, we ordered the rotisserrie chicken, it comes with fries (which we ordered crispy) and a  salad (which we had tossed), the portion is huge, and the bird was so moist and flavorful. My sister had the ceviche en leche de tigre (ceviche in tiger's milk) that was really good and pretty, we also had the chicha which was too sweet for me but my family enjoyed it, and last the ice cream dessert was delicious, I dont' even know how to say the fruit it is made of, but If looking for a not too sweet treat...this is it!! We had Ramon as a waiter and he was super, he's always very friendly and keeps up with our demands as listed above, crispy fries, toss the salad, extra sauce etc. The only thing I dislike is the tv's on, I don't know why every almost every latin business I visit has to have a tv, can't they put some nice low music so you could relax as you eat?

owner_response.author: El Rocoto P, Manager at EL ROCOTO PERUVIAN RESTAURANT, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for your time  ..... thank for you review  we want to see you soon back
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Authentic Peruvian food
data.text: Having just come back from Peru, we wanted to find some good Peruvian food.  The Salt Lake Tribune had reviewed this restaurant and liked it and we did, too.  The Pollo Brasso and Cebiche were excellent and compared to exactly what we had in Peru.  They say they even have roasted guinea pig occasionally, a real Peruvian dish.  The prices can't be beat.

owner_response.author: El Rocoto P, Manager at EL ROCOTO PERUVIAN RESTAURANT, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for your time  ..... thank for you review  we want to see you soon back
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Pésimo, mal servicio
data.text: Fue mi tercera visita a este restaurante las veces anteriores fue ókey pero hoy el servicio fue pésimo llegamos cuando solamente había dos mesas ordene una cerveza y una jarra de chicha se demoraron en traerme la cerveza aproximadamente 10 min la mesera se olvidó traerme un vaso en el cual podría servirme mi cerveza luego al pedirle un vaso para poder tomar mi cerveza me trajo un vaso sucio q de verdad no daba ganas usarlo me acerque a pedirle por favor un vaso y se molesto espere 45 min para que la comida este lista nunca llego la jarra de chicha q pedí con la cerveza la papa rellena q ordene de entrada no tenía sabor me aproxime a la señora mesera a pedirle la cuenta solo de lo q había consumido y nunca la comida ordenada estuvo lista. También al ver la carta de platos ofrecían ocopa arequipena la cual quise ordenar pero no la tenían disponible en un domingo familiar q vergüenza mejor q no pedí un rocoto arequipeno q hubiera sido una decepción por favor corrijan esa carta y entrenen a su meseros q sepan dar un buen Costumer Service
